repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: This is just a small fix that does not affect the visual appearance of either help files or the checkhealth buffer, but changes the code present in `syntax/checkhealth.vim` to use its own syntax group instead of patching an existing one from `syntax/help.vim`, and to define the highlight group with `:hi def` (before it was done without the `default` option). This patching caused a bug in that if you run `:checkhealth` once, the delimiter lines in all subsequently opened help buffers get a way more standout-ish look than the default one.

comment_data.body:
avoid abbreviations in code.
```suggestion
hi default healthSectionDelim gui=reverse cterm=reverse
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,8 +14,8 @@ syn keyword DiagnosticError ERROR[:]
 syn keyword DiagnosticWarn WARNING[:]
 syn keyword DiagnosticOk OK[:]
 " Note: hs=e starts higlighting on the title line (instead of the "===" line).
-syn match helpSectionDelim /^======*\n.*$/hs=e
-highlight helpSectionDelim gui=reverse cterm=reverse
-syn match healthHeadingChar "=" conceal cchar= contained containedin=helpSectionDelim
+syn match healthSectionDelim /^======*\n.*$/hs=e
+hi def healthSectionDelim gui=reverse cterm=reverse

comment_data.body: Are `syn` and `hi` fine in this case?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,8 +14,8 @@ syn keyword DiagnosticError ERROR[:]
 syn keyword DiagnosticWarn WARNING[:]
 syn keyword DiagnosticOk OK[:]
 " Note: hs=e starts higlighting on the title line (instead of the "===" line).
-syn match helpSectionDelim /^======*\n.*$/hs=e
-highlight helpSectionDelim gui=reverse cterm=reverse
-syn match healthHeadingChar "=" conceal cchar= contained containedin=helpSectionDelim
+syn match healthSectionDelim /^======*\n.*$/hs=e
+hi def healthSectionDelim gui=reverse cterm=reverse

comment_data.body:
`syn` and `hi` are very common, not going to deal with all that right now.

let's focus on what we control in this pr
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,8 +14,8 @@ syn keyword DiagnosticError ERROR[:]
 syn keyword DiagnosticWarn WARNING[:]
 syn keyword DiagnosticOk OK[:]
 " Note: hs=e starts higlighting on the title line (instead of the "===" line).
-syn match helpSectionDelim /^======*\n.*$/hs=e
-highlight helpSectionDelim gui=reverse cterm=reverse
-syn match healthHeadingChar "=" conceal cchar= contained containedin=helpSectionDelim
+syn match healthSectionDelim /^======*\n.*$/hs=e
+hi def healthSectionDelim gui=reverse cterm=reverse

comment_regular_data.body:
> use its own syntax group

is that required for the bug fix? if not, separate pr

> is that required for the bug fix? if not, separate pr

It is because the help delimiters and and checkhealth delimiters are two different entities, and are highlighted differently in the current version of Neovim. `s/highlight/hi def/` is not the crux of the fix.
k. saves a lot of time to start by describing the problem being solved (including in the title, as I have done) instead of the solution.
Does anything else need to be done with regards to my PR? @justinmk
Git push to origin failed for release-0.11 with exitcode 1

title: fix(health): highlight group conflicts with help
